item.title: Fak
item.dc:creator: @popcorn89 popcorn89
item.description:
@popcorn89 wrote:

The LDC constructor takes the index to the constant pool entry to push onto the stack. In this case you’d use a ConstantClass.

item.title: Fak
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

Dis prawblem, help ples.

I want to generate a method that returns a class like this:

public Class getClientClass() { return client.class; }

So I did the above and compiled it. Jackie tells me it should be this:

ldc_w client areturn

Now, what the fuck is an ldc_w, and how do I initalise it to have the (primitive? I’m not quite sure) class property. BCEL’s LDC_W wrapper class requires an int to initalise, so what would I be putting the int as? LocalVariableGen doesn’t work (getIndex()). This is probably pretty nooby, but thanks for teh help.

Read full topic
